readme:
# Typewriter Svelte

A minimal, customizable terminal-style typewriter effect component for Svelte applications. Perfect for creating command-line style interfaces or adding a retro typing animation to your text.

## Installation

```bash
npm install @burnamn/typewriter-svelte
```

## Usage

```svelte
<script>
    import { Typewriter } from '@burnamn/typewriter-svelte';
</script>

<!-- Basic usage -->
<Typewriter speed={50} textColor="#00ff00">
    tracking and analyzing...
</Typewriter>

<!-- With custom options -->
<Typewriter 
    speed={75}
    startDelay={1500}
    cursorChar="‚ñà"
    cursorColor="#00ff00"
    textColor="#00ff00"
    showCursor={true}
>
    Your gateway...
</Typewriter>
```

## Props

| Prop | Type | Default | Description |
|------|------|---------|-------------|
| `speed` | number | `50` | Typing speed in milliseconds per character |
| `startDelay` | number | `0` | Delay before typing starts (in milliseconds) |
| `showCursor` | boolean | `true` | Whether to show the blinking cursor |
| `cursorChar` | string | `'‚ñà'` | Character to use for the cursor |
| `cursorColor` | string | `'#00ff00'` | Color of the cursor |
| `textColor` | string | `'#00ff00'` | Color of the typed text |

### Terminal Command Effect
```svelte
<Typewriter speed={50} textColor="#00ff00">
    > npm install @burnamn/typewriter-svelte

```

### Matrix Style
```svelte

    speed={100}
    cursorChar="|"
    textColor="#00ff00"
    cursorColor="#00ff00"
>
    Wake up, Neo...
</Typewriter>
```
